meanings.definition: A loud and confused noise, especially that of people shouting.
meanings.sent1: The clamoring of the crowd at the concert was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The clamoring of the children playing outside could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The clamoring of the monkeys in the zoo made the visitors burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Amidst the clamoring of opinions, her voice stood out like a beacon.
meanings.sent5: The clamoring of the thunderstorm made it impossible to sleep.

meanings.sent1: She was clamoring for attention during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The fans clamored for their favorite singer to come back on stage.
meanings.sent3: The children clamored for ice cream after dinner.
meanings.sent4: The protesters clamored for justice in the streets.
meanings.sent5: His stomach clamored for food after a long day of work.
